abstract: One could almost imagine the story of Roger C. Altman set to the soundtrack of “Rudy” or “Field of Dreams.” As written by Investment Dealers’ Digest, his is a tale of setbacks — a heart transplant and a tenure in the Clinton administration cut short by Whitewater — overcome by courage and savvy. Now Mr. Altman is known as the chief of the boutique investment bank Evercore Partners, a man smart enough to have advised on AT&T‘s $90 billion acquisition of BellSouth, humble enough to have refused naming his firm after himself. (He makes sure to point the latter out.)
